author: Karl Rock
description:
The Gangireddus (Gangireddollu) are a nomadic community from South India who travel with decorated cattle, performing music and offering blessings in exchange for small donations. Their tradition comes from the belief that cows and oxen carry divine blessings. However, some shopkeepers feel pressured when they stop outside and may see it as a nuisance. There’s always something new for me to learn in India.

#india #bengaluru #bangalore #karnataka
title: South India’s Street Blessings
